meanings.sent1: The brave knight rode his warhorse into battle.
meanings.sent2: The army relied on their warhorses to carry them into the fight.
meanings.sent3: The warhorse neighed loudly, ready to charge into the enemy lines.
meanings.sent4: The warhorse galloped across the battlefield like a thundering storm.
meanings.sent5: The warhorse's hooves pounded the ground, echoing through the war-torn field.

meanings.definition: A veteran or experienced person in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The professor was a warhorse in the world of academia.
meanings.sent2: She turned to the company's warhorse for advice on the project.
meanings.sent3: The old warhorse of the team always had a story to share.
meanings.sent4: He was a warhorse in the kitchen, having cooked for decades.
meanings.sent5: The warhorse of the group guided the newcomers with wisdom and patience.
